casebody.data:
JAMES B. HORNER, et al., Plaintiffs and Respondents, v. CHARLES B. ABORN, Defendant and Appellant. CREDIBILITY OF WITNESSES.

Before Sedgwick and Speir, JJ.

Heard March, 1875; Decided May 3, 1875. Patterson & Major, for appellants. G. A. C. Barnett, for respondents. This appeal involved nothing but the credibility of plaintiffs’ witnesses. Judgment below was for plaintiffs. Sedgwick, J.,

wrote for affirmance.

Speir, J., concurred.
